full_summary:
# TBIPS - IM/IT Application Modernization Projects - Change Management and Technical Architecture

## Notice Details

- **Reference Number**: PW-23-01020505
- **Contracting Authority**: Indigenous Services Canada
- **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
- **Procurement Category**: SRV
- **Trade Agreements**: Set-Aside Program for Aboriginal Business (SPAB)
- **Regions of Opportunity**: National Capital Region (NCR)
- **Regions of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)

## Description of Work

Indigenous Services Canada (ISC) is seeking qualified suppliers for modernization projects related to the Information Technology (IT) and Management (HM) applications. The successful supplier will provide change management and technical architecture services to support the translation and integration of First Nations and Inuit Health (FNIH) and other special projects. The contract will be for a period of two years, with the option to extend for an additional three years.

## Security Requirements

- **Common PS SRCL**: #10 applies
- **Minimum Corporate Security**: Designated Organization Screening (DOS)
- **Minimum Resource Security**: Enhanced Reliability

## Estimated Level of Effort

- 220 days per year
- per resource category

## Contract Duration

- Two (2) years
- Option for three (3) one-year extensions

## Anticipated Start Date

- April 1, 2023

## Notice Information

- **Publication Date**: January 9, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: February 3, 2023
- **Contracting Authority**: Christine Madore
- **Phone Number**: 873-354-1376
- **Email Address**: christine.Madore@sac-isc.gc.ca

## Prohibited or Restricted Goods

- The use of prohibited or restricted goods is deemed unacceptable.

## Application Information

- Further information and documentation can be requested from the Contracting Authority above.
- Bidders must submit a proposal for all the required resource categories.
- The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

## Method of Supply

- This procurement is implemented under the Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) method of supply.

Note: The content of this synopsis may not be reviewed or updated. Consult the Solicitation Documents for the latest information.
